bibl.title: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Domingo F. Ramos to Philip Showalter Hench, May 5, 1941

div1.p: Ramos assures Hench that the Cuban government and health workers appreciate the effort Hench has made to locate the Camp Lazear site, and acknowledges the tribute owed to Lazear.

div1.head: English translation [from Spanish] of letter from Domingo F. Ramos to Philip Showalter Hench, May 5, 1941 See Spanish original.
div1.opener:
EL MINISTRO DE DEFENSA NACIONAL
Havana, May 5, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Distinguished and dear colleague:
div1.p:
The Government of Cuba and the doctors and
sanitarians of this country have followed, step by
step, the patient and diligent work which you have
been carrying out to locate, clear and definitely,
the sites where the Commission of medical officers
of the United States Army, composed of Reed, Carroll,
Agramonte and Lazear confirmed the discovery of
Carlos J. Finlay relating to the transmission of
yellow fever by the mosquito vector. We consider it
a duty on our part to signilize the appreciation with
which the Government of Cuba, the health officers of
the country and the entire medical body have watched
your work and the diligence you have applied to same.

In the same manner we wish to make patent
our admiration and gratitute for the purposes which
animate you to erect in Cuba a monument or memorial
of Dr. Jesse W. Lazear, the martyr of the Yellow
Fever Commission, who not only contributed his know-
ledge to the Commission but bravely sacrificed his
life to throw light on one of the most transcendental
points in the history of American civilization. To
Jesse W. Lazear our continent owes a tribute such as
that rendered to the most notable of the martyrs
which have figured in the history of scientific dis-
coveries.

Accept, Dr. Hench, all to which we have
given expression in the preceding lines, the testim-
ony of gratitute and appreciation which we send you
in this letter.

closer.salute:
I am, your affectionate friend and collea-
gue
